Research Note Vault
- Single-file HTML app with inline CSS and JS, no external dependencies.
- **Core UI**: Clean, print-friendly layout with header ("Research Note Vault"), main note list, and input form. Use semantic HTML (nav, main, article). Dark/light mode toggle via prefers-color-scheme and button.
- **Note Management**:
  - Add notes: Title input (max 100 chars), content textarea (max 5000 chars), tags input (comma-separated).
  - List all notes chronologically (newest first), each as expandable card showing title, preview (first 100 chars), tags, date, word count.
  - Edit/delete notes via inline buttons on expanded cards.
  - Search: Live filter by title/content/tags via input at top.
- **Offline-First Persistence**: Store notes as JSON array in localStorage ('research-notes-v1'). Auto-save on every change. Validate/load data on init with fallback to empty array.
- **Undo/Redo**: Maintain command history stack (up to 50 actions: add/edit/delete). Ctrl+Z/Y keyboard shortcuts + buttons. Commands store full note snapshots.
- **Accessibility**: ARIA labels/roles, keyboard nav (Tab/arrow keys for list, Enter to expand), high-contrast CSS, screen-reader friendly announcements for actions.
- **Print-Friendly**: @media print hides controls, formats notes as single-column list with full content, titles bold, dates italic.
- **Advanced Filters**: Dropdown for "All/Recent (7 days)/Tagged", tag cloud showing popular tags (click to filter).
- **Stats Panel**: Toggleable sidebar with total notes, words today, longest note, most used tags.
- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Ctrl+N new note, Ctrl+S save (noop, auto-saves), Ctrl+P print, Ctrl+F search focus, Esc clear filters.
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first CSS grid/flexbox, works offline (no service worker needed).
- **Data Format**: Each note {id: uuid(via Date.now()+Math.random()), title, content, tags[], created, updated, wordCount}.
- **Edge Cases**: Handle localStorage quota (prompt to clear if >80% used via navigator.storage.estimate), prevent duplicate IDs, graceful degradation on old browsers (fallback to sessionStorage).
- **Visual Style**: Minimalist sans-serif font, subtle shadows, green accents for actions, smooth transitions (<0.3s).
